NCS – you have hours to make up before you can graduate
Dear {!Contact.Name} and Parent/Guardian,
Now that you have nearly completed NCS, your thoughts are probably turning to graduation.
You missed part of the programme but don't worry, you can still complete the programme and graduate - all you need to do is make up hours through volunteering. If you feel that volunteering will be difficult for you, please contact us. You can call us on 020 3542 2400 or email us at contact@ncsthechallenge.org
Based on your attendance so far, you need to complete {!Attendance__c.Hours_required_for_graduation_form__c} hours of volunteering.
If you miss any more of the programme, you may need to make up more hours. Unfortunately, if you miss too much of the programme, you may not be allowed to graduate. Once you have completed the programme and made up your hours, you will receive a certificate signed by the Prime Minister to reflect your achievement and show you have completed NCS.
The deadline for telling us about the hours you have made up in time for your graduation ceremony is midday on the day before your graduation.
Your graduation ceremony will be on {!Attendance__c.Graduation_date__c}. We will send you specific details about your graduation venue and time in early March.
How do I complete my hours of volunteering? You and your parent/guardian will need to organise your own volunteering. Please contact us if you feel that you will not be able to do this. It can be any activity that involves spending time doing something that aims to benefit the environment or community. Please note that you cannot get paid for it and it cannot be just helping relatives or friends. Other than that, you get to decide!
Examples of activities that can be used: • Leading sessions at a local youth group or uniformed group such as guides or scouts. • Giving time to a local community member, group or charity, e.g. volunteering at local charity shop or in the office of a local charity, acting as a marshal at a charity fun run. • Running an after school sports club for younger pupils.
If you cannot think of any suitable volunteering activities, please contact us to discuss the options.
Examples of activities that cannot be used: • Giving time to a profit making organisation. • Paid work for a local charity or community group, e.g. being paid to distribute leaflets promoting a charity. • Helping relatives or friends, e.g. cooking a relative dinner.
How do I tell you when I have completed my volunteering? You need to log in to The Challenge Society website ( https://www.thechallengesociety.org/ ), using the TCS login card you were given during the programme (or the ‘forgot your details’ option on the website). Then click on Log my hours and add your own volunteering task to enter your volunteering details. Please note that we cannot log your volunteering hours over the phone.
We will then process the information you submit. This may involve verifying that you have completed the hours by getting in touch with the volunteering contact you have provided.
What if I don't make up my hours? Don't worry, you will still be invited to attend the graduation ceremony alongside your teammates; however, you will not be able to receive your graduation certificate. If you still have hours to make up at the end of the programme, we will send you another email with the number of hours you have outstanding.
More questions? You can speak to the staff on your programme about the hours you need to make up. Alternatively, you can email us at contact@ncsthechallenge.org or call us on 020 3542 2400.
Please note that if you reply to this email directly it will not be responded to - please use the contact details above for any enquiries.
Yours sincerely,
Rachel Slade - Head of Programmes The Challenge
